Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • Packet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataPacket, RoutingPacket

    public abstract class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a generic Packet which contains a destination IPAddress, a source IPAddress, and some data represented by a String.

    Read packets by using the readPacket(Scanner scanner) method.
    The type of packet needs to be determined before hand.
    Author:
    Mark kaganovsky
    See Also:
    RoutingPacket, DataPacket, IPAddress

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Packet()
      Default constructor, creates a new default destination IPAddress, source IPAddress, and an empty packetData String

    • Constructor Detail

      • Packet

        public Packet()
        Default constructor, creates a new default destination IPAddress, source IPAddress, and an empty packetData String

    • Method Detail

      • readPacket

        public boolean readPacket(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        This packet reads the destination IPAddress, Source IPAddress and the packet Data String. If this method returns false, then the rest of the line is still in the buffer and needs to be consumed by the calling function.
        Parameters:
        scanner - A scanner object to read from.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the packet was valid or not (false = invalid).

      • getDestNetwork

        public IPAddress getDestNetwork()
        Returns:
        An IPAddress object representing the destination NETWORK IP of this packet.

      • getPacketData

        public java.lang.String getPacketData()
        Returns:
        The data contained in this packet, not including the source and destination IP

      • processFoundPacket

        public abstract boolean processFoundPacket(java.lang.String port)
        Processes a packet which is found in the routing table (Simply prints what action is taken on this packet by the Router class).
        Parameters:
        port - The port code String (example 'e0') which the packet is being sent out.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating to the Router whether or not to add this packet to the routing table (true = add to table).

      • processNotFoundPacket

        public abstract boolean processNotFoundPacket(java.lang.String port)
        Processes a packet which is not found in the routing table (Simply prints what action is taken on this packet by the Router class).
        Parameters:
        port - The port code String (example 'e0') which the packet is being sent out.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating to the Router whether or not to add this packet to the routing table (true = add to table).
